intro: Capsicum annuum var. purpureum, commonly known as the purple bell pepper, is a cultivar of the common chili pepper species. It is characterized by its elongated, bell-shaped fruits that range in color from deep purple to reddish-pink as they mature. The plant typically grows as an annual, reaching heights of 30–60 cm with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bilaterally symmetrical, typical of the Solanaceae family. The fruit develops from a single ovary and contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed when the fruit dries and splits open.
